column3: FWIW: The H2O repo has a very good HTTP/1.1 seed corpus which can be used to seed this fuzzer: https://github.com/h2o/h2o/tree/master/fuzz
ACK, except for the unnecessary changes.
@MarcoFalke Would you mind reviewing this PR? :)
Ready for merge? :)
Is the feedback addressed: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18363#issuecomment-601216995 ?
@MarcoFalke Dropped the mechanical `clang-format`/`clang-tidy` commit :)  Please re-review :)
I don't really have a strong background in libevent and our http server, so I'll leave this with @laanwj :)
@MarcoFalke He said "ACK, except for the unnecessary changes." :)
@MarcoFalke Feedback addressed! Ready for merge? :)
ACK cdfb8e7afa7648405dd6b957f47b1c7ab566a076
Why is `WriteReply` not tested?

`WriteReply` creates and triggers a `HTTPEvent` which I didn't want in a unit test :)\n\nMore generally: some decoupling from `libevent` wouldn't hurt in `HTTPRequest`. For example, notice that `HTTPRequest::~HTTPRequest` calls `WriteReply(â€¦)` (by default) :)
style-nit: Could add a newline after `:` to save some whitespace
Fixed in a way that `clang-format` appreciates :)
I like to put each member in a separate line so that adding or removing one is less likely to conflict with other related changes, but no biggie
Can `.clang-format` be changed to get that behaviour?

I already knows it, you just have to add the newlines manually:

```
$ git diff && (git diff|cfd) && git diff 
diff --git a/src/httpserver.cpp b/src/httpserver.cpp
index 7282b517f4..3b2e644319 100644
--- a/src/httpserver.cpp
+++ b/src/httpserver.cpp
@@ -510,7 +510,9 @@ void HTTPEvent::trigger(struct timeval* tv)
     else
         evtimer_add(ev, tv); // trigger after timeval p
This (moving `}` from a new line to the end of the line) doesn't look like a sensible change.
Why does this include a change in `locale.cpp` in the first place?
This is just `clang-format -i` doing its work :)
C++11 allows trailing commas, so that should be preferred, imo
I really don't have any opinion TBH: I'm happy with whatever `clang-format -i` outputs :)
Maybe leave the second commit for a later fuzz pull request, so that people here can focus on the fuzz test itself for review?

```suggestion
test_fuzz_http_request_SOURCES = test/fuzz/http_request.cpp
```

Needs rebase
Fixed! :)
